subject: Testing setUp & tearDown with testEmpty() <--> dry RunTest ?
msgSnippet: I m working on my Developper certification & decided to do it with JUnit as a Do-as-I-do . I come with regularly testing cases where the DB-file is created
messageBody:
I'm working on my Developper certification & decided to do it with JUnit as
a "Do-as-I-do" .
I come with regularly testing cases where the DB-file is created before
hand,
then other testcases where the DB-file cannot be there before hand...
I grouped the TestCases according to this "technical requierment" so the
setUp
& tearDown
can do the job once for all the TestCases.

I realized that I regularly implement TestCase with an empty testMethod that
validates the
correctness of the setUp & tearDown.
As I find that strange but usefull, I was wandering if there was someone
else facing similar
odd behavior....

:-))) Does someone wants to share the felling with me, or am I that
different ?:-)))

Tx,

Thomas,





--
Thomas SMETS
